channel.title: TOR Time Sync in a personal OS
channel.description: Hi, i tried to install tor and arm on my simple OS . It runs correctly but arm provides me the alert about time sync, how can I implement whonix network time sync ? Or there are other methods ? is it a big problem the time sync on my personal OS ? However i have UTC time .

item.title: TOR Time Sync in a personal OS
item.dc:creator: Hiberts
item.description:
Wait, it’s hard for me .
I will come back in the future on this question .
Thanks for links !

Read full topic
item.source: TOR Time Sync in a personal OS

item.title: TOR Time Sync in a personal OS
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
For Whonix users, official advice for host’s:

  • https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Post_Install_Advice#Network_Time_Syncing
  • https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Advanced_Security_Guide#Network_Time_Synchronization

There are “upstream projects”, which likely(!) work on [most?] Debian based operating systems [or even other Linux’s?], they likely work or would only need little effort to make them work, but this is [still] unsupported by the Whonix team:

  • https://github.com/Whonix?utf8=✓&query=sdwdate
  • https://github.com/Whonix?utf8=✓&query=timesync

What do you mean by unsupported?
-> https://www.whonix.org/wiki/FAQ#What_do_you_mean_by_unsupported.3F

Read full topic

item.title: TOR Time Sync in a personal OS

item.description:
Hi,
i tried to install tor and arm on my simple OS .
It runs correctly but arm provides me the alert about time sync, how can I implement whonix network time sync ?
Or there are other methods ?
is it a big problem the time sync on my personal OS ? However i have UTC time .
